title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts and Bucks - BBC News
summary: man accused of keeping the murder of his sister-in-law secret for 12 years to face a retrial .
bedford college to merge with tresham college .
repair is underway to get airlander 10 back in the skies .
hertfordshire-based tesco has rationed customers to three iceberg lettuces per visit .
bad parking blocks hertfordshire fire station .

documents.title: watford 2-1 burnley
text: watford 2-1 burnley
author: Mike Whalley
BBC Sport

documents.title: goodbye
text: that 's it for this week from all of us here at local live for beds , herts and bucks .
we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday with yet more news , sport , travel and weather .
we hope you have a great weekend .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pearson moving to new offices in harlow
text: education publishing firm pearson is moving its 300 harlow-based staff to a new building on the kao park in the harlow enterprise zone .
pearson , which is at present based in edinburgh in the town , will occupy 28,000 sq ft of the new kao two office building where the company has agreed a 10 year lease .
pearson 's move , due in the summer , is part of a £ 25m long term investment and will continue an association with harlow that goes back over 40 years .
rod bristow , president of pearson uk , said : `` kao park has a long history of scientific and technological breakthroughs .
`` having pearson in the campus is befitting as this site is best suited for any business looking to place itself firmly at the forefront of research and innovation . ''

documents.title: college merger creates 'one of the most exciting colleges in uk '
text: bedford college will merge with tresham college this summer , and according to bedford 's principal and chief executive , ian pryce , it will create `` one of the most exciting colleges in the uk '' .
he added once `` due diligence and consultation has been completed '' , all staff , assets and liabilities will transfer to bedford college corporation .
the college states that `` students and staff at the colleges will continue as usual , and current courses will not be affected '' .

documents.title: concern grows for missing buckinghamshire teenager
text: police say they 're growing `` increasingly concerned '' for a missing `` vulnerable '' 15-year-old boy with autism .
they say ben thomas was last seen at a shop on oxford road , stokenchurch , at 15:15 on monday .
sgt matthew jones , from thames valley police , believes he `` has his bus pass so he might be travelling around the local area by bus '' .
he added : `` ben , if you are reading this , please make contact with your family or police so we know you are safe and well . ''
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: howzat !
text: alastair cook was n't caught out today when he collected his cbe from the prince of wales .
we do think he might have been bowled over though !
howzat !
alastair cook , captain @ twitterid has collected his cbe today from the prince of wales at buckingham palace .
@ twitterid @ twitterid alastair2 cook our pride
thoroughly deserved all round great captain huge role model
very well deserved .
congrats to cookie .
prince charles seems such a wonderful , warm , people-person .
love to see him chatting and laughing with folks .
well done and congratulations to alastair cook
@ twitterid
plumb lbw .
zero runs .
brilliant , manly because of how much @ twitterid will love this
joe root play there match whar
cbe ?
these seem to get handed out like smarties these days !
well deserved
now resign
congrats
@ twitterid @ twitterid well chuffed for # alastaircook totally deserved # congratulations
cookie and the grandson of cookie

documents.title: a rat bite , a broken toe nail and a woman who wanted an escort home
text: those are just some of the 312 hoax and inappropriate calls our region 's paramedics had to deal with between april and december last year .
some of the calls included
the county breakdown of hoax and inappropriate calls to the east of england ambulance service is :
gary morgan , from the ambulance service , said : `` we 'd urge the public to remember that the ambulance service is for emergencies . ''
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: airlander 10 : inspiring the next generation of engineers ?
text: it shows that if you do n't ask , you do n't get

fourteen pupils from castle newnham school in bedford recently visited the site after a member of the student news team , duncan , asked if they could visit hybrid air vehicles to see what goes on behind the massive hangar doors .
they found out it 's called the airlander 10 as it has the ability to carry 10 tonnes of cargo .
teacher ms carlie , said : `` no-one had realised it was quite so big . ''
she also confirmed the visit sparked their interest , as duncan is now `` determined to follow a similar career path '' .
but they could n't get any confirmation on when it will be back in the skies - only that it will be `` soon '' .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: airlander 10 : testing started after 'heavy landing '
text: testing has started on the airlander 10 aircraft , after it was damaged in a crash landing on its second test flight in august .
the world 's longest aircraft , which was built at cardington airfield , has now been repaired .
the fixed flight deck ( know as the mission module ) is now back in place
the pilot 's consoles have now been installed
and the mission module is now reattached to the hull .
it 's not yet known when the martha gwyn ( as it 's also known ) will return to the skies over bedfordshire , but i have been told it will be this year .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'rugby is a great sport for women ' # getinspired
text: it 's not only the men 's six nations that kicks off this weekend .
the women 's equivalent gets under way , too , with scotland hosting ireland this evening , followed tomorrow by wales v italy and - arguably the of the ties - england v france at twickenham .

the women 's game is really taking off across the uk , so watch england full-back danielle waterman explain her love of rugby and the different versions you can play - and if you 're inspired to up the oval ball yourself , check out our get inspired guide .
england women v france women kicks off at 19:35 gmt on saturday , with live coverage on bbc radio 5 live sports extra , plus highlights of all three matches on bbc two at 22:45 gmt .

documents.title: broxbourne borough u18s hope for more fa cup glory at villa
text: it 's a david and goliath match , a minnows versus giants game , and any other big and small football cliche you can think of
this weekend broxbourne borough continue their amazing fa cup exploits as they play their fifth round tie in the youth cup .
the u18 side has outperformed the likes of manchester united and arsenal to reach this stage in the competition and are playing aston villa at villa park on saturday .
coach roy bleau has told the bbc that training was going `` really well '' and the boys were `` looking good '' - but what is the secret of their success ?
`` i keep saying to people , the secret is really like most things in life - hard work , '' he said .
`` we 've been working hard at it , the boys are obviously talented because you ca n't get this far if you 're not , [ but ] they 've bought into everything that we 've done with them .
`` on certain occasions you need a bit of luck here and there , which we 've had , but fundamentally they 're good players and they 've been playing to their potential . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sean dyche will 'park ' his attachment to hornets
text: at the end of an emotional week for the hornets , former watford player and manager sean dyche said he must leave his sense of attachment to the club `` parked '' when his burnley side play at vicarage road on saturday .

the match takes place three days after the funeral of graham taylor , who was watford 's chairman when the former hornets centre-back dyche was promoted from coaching staff to his first managerial job in 2011 .
he has already stressed the respect he has for watford , even after being dismissed as manager by the new italian owners after one season .
he said : `` the fact is i had some very good years at that club , including with graham for a year when i was manager .
`` so there is a lot of attachment - but it is parked before we play them on saturday , i can assure you . ''

dyche , who attended the funeral , said of wednesday 's service : `` they are not easy affairs , of course , for anyone , and not when you have got someone who is so big for what he has done in the game .
`` i thought it was handled fantastically well by all . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: so can you lead a horse to a field ?
text: you can lead a horse to water , but can you help it back into its field safely ?
this was the challenge set to officers in wycombe when they were trying to return loose horses in wooburn green .
luckily some local residents were on hand to help
and the horses were returned to their field safe and sound .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: alastair cook investiture : prince of wales discusses bedfordshire farm
text: alastair cook , who was appointed a cbe by the prince of wales , said prince charles chatted to the cricketer about the farm run by his wife 's family in bedfordshire , where he helps out .
the prince runs duchy home farm in gloucestershire .

speaking after the buckingham palace investiture ceremony , which he attended with his wife alice ( above ) , cook said : `` we spoke a little bit about the cricket , a little bit about the farming , and he wished me good luck .
`` we 're about to start lambing so we 'll get busy now , but unfortunately work and training has to come first , but if i have any spare moments i 'll try and help out . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: alastair cook receives cbe at buckingham palace
text: england cricket captain alastair cook has been appointed a cbe by the prince of wales .
the essex batsman and former bedford school captain was at buckingham palace with his wife alice .
he described it as a `` very proud moment '' .
`` this is a very special moment , not just for me , obviously , but my family and friends , '' he said .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bedford and tresham college merger for 'financial security '
text: earlier we mentioned two colleges in northamptonshire and bedfordshire were joining forces .
once the merger between tresham and bedford college is complete , tresham will dissolve and its staff , assets and liabilities will transfer to bedford college .
bedford college principal and chief executive , ian pryce , said : `` the combined college will have the size and scale to ensure strong support services and financial security . ''
it 's hoped the larger college will raise standards at tresham .
students and staff will continue as normal and current courses wo n't be affected .
the new merged college will have an income of £ 60m and a total number of 15,000 students .
the demolition of tresham college 's campus at wellingborough has begun , but it will no longer be building a replacement due to financial issues , with courses switched to corby .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: giant water storage tank being built at grafham water
text: anglian water has announced £ 425m of investment over the next year that it says is needed to keep taps running in one of the uk 's driest areas .
part of the investment is a brand new storage tank at grafham water , which will hold the equivalent of 16 olym swimming pools of water .
construction on the mega structure is now finished , with the tank set to be in use by early march .
we were given access yesterday , before the lid was sealed shut
the `` resilience tank '' took a year and a half to construct .
it 's held up by 90 pillars and stands at 5m ( 16ft ) tall - about the height of a double decker bus .
anglian water says bills will rise by about 2 % to cover the cost of the investment .
however , a spokesman for the company says bills are still lower than they were four years ago .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: aidy boothroyd appointed england u21 boss
text: former watford and northampton town boss aidy boothroyd has been confirmed as manager of the england under-21 team .
the under-20 boss replaces gareth southgate , who vacated the role to become england manager after the departure of sam allardyce .
boothroyd , 45 , took charge for the u21 side 's final two euro 2017 qualifiers and secured qualification for this summer 's finals in poland .
`` i 've been at the fa three years ; this is the logical next step , '' he said .
boothroyd was in charge of watford for three seasons from 2005 , initially saving the club from relegation to the third tier before leading them to the top flight in 2006 .
the vicarage road side finished bottom of the premier league the following season .
he later took charge of northampton town in november 2011 with the side bottom of league two .
boothroyd guided them to safety , and the play-offs the next season , before being sacked in 2013 with the club once again last in the fourth tier .
after his sacking from the cobblers he joined the fa 's coaching staff .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: four more arrests after body found in mk car park
text: police in milton keynes have arrested four more people in connection with the death of a man , whose body was found near great linford co-op last month .
two 36-year-old men , a 32-year-old man and a 30-year-old man , all from milton keynes , have been arrested on sus of murder and bailed .
four people have already been charged with the murder of 32-year-old suren sivananthan , from canada , and are due to stand trial in july .
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: watch : 10 seconds from being crushed by a tree
text: a driver has narrowly escaped a falling tree in the bedfordshire village of eversholt .
cctv footage below shows there was just 10 seconds between the car going past and a tree collapsing on the road
thanks to local resident emrys williams for the footage that was recorded on tuesday .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: luton buried body : man to face re-trial
text: a man accused of keeping the murder of his sister-in-law secret for 12 years will face a retrial in july .
a jury at luton crown court last month could not agree on a series of charges against joseph doherty , relating to an alleged cover up over the death of natalia wilkanowska .
her body was found under builders ' rubble at a house in luton in 2015 .
she disappeared 12 years earlier in 2003 having been to meet ex-husband gerald doherty in the bedfordshire town .
he was found hanged later that year .

joseph doherty , 73 , from old greenock road , port glasgow , denied one charge of perverting the course of justice , one of obstructing the coroner by giving a false account of her death and one charge of preventing her lawful burial .
his re-trial has been set for 17 july and he remains on bail .
at the first trial , joseph doherty 's brother , daniel doherty , was cleared of similar charges .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: lincoln sign striker southwell
text: lincoln sign striker southwell

documents.title: tresham college merges with bedford college
text: tresham college , which has campuses at kettering , corby and silverstone in northamptonshire , is to merge with bedford college .

as reported in the northamptonshire telegraph , ofsted inspectors have been critical of standards at tresham and the further education commissioner has been involved with directing the work of the college .
the colleges aim to complete the merger by september .
we 'll bring you more on this story soon .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: everybody 'romaine ' calm !
text: as iceberg lettuce rationing hits beds , herts and bucks , some people are taking to desperate measures to get some .
but do n't take a leaf out of my book and do what i 've just done
it 's not `` lettuce-celery '' a disaster , but `` lettuce know what you think '' via twitter using # bhblive or email .
can you cope with these puns any more ?
cos i ca n't
iceberg lettuce rationing .
three per visit in tesco
iceberg are awful lettuce so perhaps people may move to a lettuce that has some flavour to it .
eat chips instead !
there will be loads of underworld criminals setting up iceberg lettuce farms in three bedroom houses as we speak
hahahaha legend
an iceberg lettuce rationing .
how will we all survive ?
author: Justin Dealey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: lettuce shortage just the tip of the iceberg ?
text: hertfordshire-based tesco has rationed customers to three iceberg lettuces per visit - blaming poor growing conditions in europe for a shortage in uk stores .
it said bad weather in spain had caused `` availability issues '' , but suppliers were working to resolve the problem .
customers have posted photographs on social media of empty lettuce shelves in tesco stores , alongside signs asking them to limit lettuce purchases .

it follows reports in the daily mail that morrisons had also limited shoppers to three heads of broccoli and three iceberg lettuces , and last month there was a uk courgette shortage after wet and cold weather in southern europe devastated crops .
if any more vegetable rationing sprouts up we 'll let you know .
this could be just the tip of the iceberg .

documents.title: gas repairs cause traffic problems in st albans
text: there are still traffic delays in st albans due to national grid carrying out `` essential repairs '' to the gas mains .
work started yesterday by the a5183 verulam road and it 's set to continue until wednesday .
the company has apologised for any inconvenience caused , saying the `` vital work '' would be `` completed as soon as possible '' .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: alastair cook to be made cbe
text: essex batsman and former bedford school cricket captain alastair cook will be appointed a cbe by the prince of wales today .

current england captain cook , who was awarded an mbe in 2011 following the ashes success in australia , last year became the first englishman and youngest batsman worldwide to reach 10,000 test runs .
he scored 766 runs in england 's 2010-11 ashes series win over australia , averaging 127 , and took over as captain in august 2012 after the retirement of andrew strauss .

the world of cricket is waiting to see if the opening batsman will remain in his role as captain or - as is widely anticipated - step down after the recent disappointing england tour of india , which saw cook 's side well beaten .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man rescued from grand union canal
text: firefighters have rescued a man stuck in 3ft ( 91cm ) of water in the aylesbury arm of the grand union canal .
two crews were called to oakfield road in the town just before 23:00 last night .
he was left in the care of paramedics .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ticket giveaway at mk dons
text: from one type of ticket to another
a large crowd is expected at stadium : mk tomorrow for mk dons against bolton - and as part of the 50th birthday celebrations of the town , a free ticket is available for every resident .
but time is running out , as you need to get it by 17:00 by going to stadium : mk or centre : mk .
season ticket holders and club dons members outside the mk postcode can also claim a free ticket to give to someone .
author: Luke Ashmead
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: did you buy a euromillions ticket in high wycombe ?
text: turn out your pockets , empty your drawers and reach down to the murky depths of your handbags and manbags one lucky punter in buckinghamshire has only five more days to claim a £ 1m euromillions prize .
the search is on to find the person who bought the winning ticket in high wycombe , which was drawn on 12 august last year .
players are being urged to check their tickets for the code gsz 040219 .
lottery officials say if the prize is not claimed by wednesday , 8 february , the prize money will be used for community projects across the uk .
oh , and if you 're not a traditionalist , check your emails / online lottery account too !
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: helen bailey trial : called off today
text: the trial of the man accused of murdering hertfordshire author helen bailey has been called off today after the judge at st albans crown court announced that a juror 's mother was terminally ill .
it 's hoped proceedings will continue on monday .
helen bailey 's fiance , 56-year-old ian stewart , denies murdering the author at their home in royston last year .
author: Kate Bradbrook
BBC Look East

documents.title: bad parking blocks hertfordshire fire station
text: hertfordshire fire and rescue is urging people not to park illegally outside fire stations and say they will use cctv to enforce the message .
wheathampstead has had a problem with people parking in the driveway outside the marford road station .

david johnston , from the parish council , said : `` we 've had an ongoing problem with people parking inconsiderately very close to the entrance so that when the fire engine tries to get out it has trouble swinging out into the road .
`` recently we had one vehicle which actually parked directly in front of the gates . ''
herts fire and rescue area commander jonathan smith , said : `` for whatever reason people think it 's acceptable just to nip into the shop and park outside a fire station .
`` we are going to be starting to put cctv on some of our stations , particularly our rural stations , so if people are parking illegally they will be caught on camera . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: today 's weather : a bright start but windy
text: today is due to be very blustery - but mostly dry - during daylight hours although some cloud will push in from the west this afternoon bringing light patchy rain and drizzle in some places .
maximum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
the met office has issued a yellow warning of wind as gales are expected on friday and into saturday morning with inland locations likely to see a relatively short period of 40-50 mph gusts .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates from beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome to thursday 's live page for the three counties where we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather until 18:00 .
today , after yesterday 's break , the trial of ian stewart , the man accused of murdering his partner helen bailey resumes with the case for the prosecution expected to wind up .
we 'll also be looking at how hertfordshire-based tesco have started rationing lettuces - but i 'll `` leaf '' that news there for the moment .
meanwhile , you can contact us at any time via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: coventry city 's owner in new legal row
text: coventry city 's owner in new legal row

documents.title: tunisia survivor 'tried to save fiancee '
text: tunisia survivor 'tried to save fiancee '

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: that 's all our live coverage done for the day .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow with live updates of news , weather , travel and sport - but any breaking news will be posted here overnight .
thanks for your company .
see you in 40 winks .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cooler tonight , mixed tomorrow
text: apart from the odd shower it will be a mostly dry night with clear spells developing .
a cooler night than last night as winds ease , with lows of 5-7c ( 41-45f ) .
a cooler start tomorrow with some early sunshine .
turning cloudy later , with patchy rain spreading in by the afternoon .
the rain will be accompanied by freshening winds , with gusts of 40-50mph possible overnight .
highs tomorrow of 10c ( 50f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: three men arrested after vans with 'stolen tools worth thousands ' found in hertford
text: hertfordshire police has arrested three people after recovering three vans full of stolen tools .
police were called to reports of people trying door handles of sheds in farm close , hertford , at 18:22 yesterday .
officers attended and located three men in the car park on carlton avenue .
a large amount of power tools , thought to be worth thousands of pounds , were found in three vans .
a 24-year-old man from ballymahon , a 30-year-old of no fixed address and a 29-year-old from hertford have been arrested on sus of handling stolen goods .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tunisia terror attack victim tells inquest she 'pretended to be dead '
text: a woman from watford who survived the terror attack on tourists in tunisia has told an inquest how she came face to face with the gunman who shot her and her husband before calmly walking away .
christopher dyer , 32 , from watford , was killed in the attack in june 2015 .
his wife , gina van dort , said she and her husband were shot as they crouched behind a car trying to hide from the gunman .
she said he walked towards them , shot them and walked away ; with a stoic , unimpressed , blank look on his face .
realising she was still alive , she closed her eyes and stopped breathing , pretending to be dead .
the court heard as she lay next to her husband 's body she was able to wave to a man who was helping others .
the inquest into the death of 30 britons at the resort is continuing at london 's high court .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: deal ends southern rail dispute
text: southern railway and train drivers ' union aslef have announced an end to their dispute over driver-only trains .
passengers have suffered months of disruption to services because of strikes .
some services from milton keynes and watford were affected .
tuc general secretary frances o'grady , said : `` we recognise that this long-running dispute has been extraordinarily difficult for everyone , including passengers and those staff involved .
`` we are glad that the parties have negotiated an agreement that not only provides a sound basis on which to resolve their dispute , but also to restore good industrial relations for the future . ''
details of the agreement have yet to be made public .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: diy store opening causes aussie sizzle
text: diy store opening causes aussie sizzle

documents.title: bunnings opening : 'everything is the same as in australia '
text: the australian hardware store , bunnings , has opened its first uk store in st albans today , and i 've been down to see what all the fuss is about .

there 's been speculation as to whether it will live up to those stores down under , but a bunnings employee told me : `` everything is exactly the same as in australia , except there are pound signs instead of dollar signs . ''
as mentioned in our previous post , it seems to be the sausage sizzles that are creating a buzz , getting many aussie ex-pats excited .
i was informed the sausage stand would be outside at weekends , but the store has prepared for the british weather and will set up a tent , so `` if it 's drizzly it will be ok '' .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: stevenage boss finds loneliness tough
text: stevenage boss finds loneliness tough

documents.title: a rival to the infamous ikea meatballs ?
text: earlier we mentioned aussie diy giant bunnings had opened its first uk store , in st albans .
but what 's delighting people most on social media , perhaps unsurprisingly , is its sausage snacks .
down under bunnings is famed for its sausage sizzles - a sausage with onions encased in white bread .
the store opening has also been widely reported by the australian media , with one outlet asking : `` do poms love a sausage sizzle ? ''
there are plans to open four stores by june , with another six by the end of the year .
the bunnings brand is a welcome reminder of life down under for the thousands of australians living in the uk .
i 've already seen some musings among aussies on social media about them making a pilgrimage to st albans .
author: Usman Azad
BBC Three Counties reporter (and Australian expat)

documents.title: heathrow third runway : public consultation begins
text: a public consultation starts today on plans to build a third runway at heathrow airport .
it 's expected to last 16 weeks .
buckinghamshire county council says it supports expansion , but wants road and other improvements for towns and villages in the south of the county .
a consultation event for buckinghamshire will take place in gerrards cross next month .
transport secretary chris grayling says he wants to allay the concerns of opponents who are worried about noise and air pollution .
`` we are now seeing a new generation of aircraft that are much quieter , much more fuel efficient and they will totally transform the environment around our airports , '' he said .
`` of course there is an impact of noise and we 've got a world-beating package of compensation for those affected by the new runway - but planes are getting quieter all the time . ''
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: police fine 'pavement blockers '
text: hertfordshire police has tweeted about its clampdown on cars parking on pavements in the county
snt officers issuing £ 30 fines for vehicles causing an obstruction to the footpath .
some vehicles were completely blocking the pavement .
west street is really bad for this .
always double parked cars blocking the footpath .
saw a fire truck struggling to pass .
thanks marcus .
will take a look as part of our patrols .
what are you doing about these ?
you can trace the keeper from the number plate .
what road is this ?
junction of cotton rd and trewenna , potters bar .
@ twitterid need to take a look along kings road , 2 cars currently obstructing path + junction .

go & look along north road between the bridge & cemetery , loads of cars parked on the pavement to avoid the station car park

take walk their child in the middle of a busy road .
ticket this area .
you should drive up musley hill in ware , particularly north past grasmere road .
pedestrians have to walk in the road !
have a look on high oak road in ware around the pub .
well done !
there 's too much of this in hertford , forcing pedestrians into the road .
about time !
the pathway is completely blocked that side of ware road !
it 's dangerous for pedestrians , cars & buses !
following complaints re `` pavement blocking '' we have issued 10 tickets .
if you want to stop this behaviour pls rt to spread
sect 72 ha ?

lots of parking on double yellow & path .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: norwich youngsters take on spurs in fa youth cup
text: norwich city 's under-18s take on tottenham hotspur tonight in the 5th round of the fa youth cup .
the match was originally due to take place last month , but was postponed due to a frozen pitch .
the match takes place at stevenage 's lamex stadium , with a 19:00 kick-off .
the winners will travel to newcastle in the quarter-finals .
best of luck to our youngsters in the # fayouthcup against spurs tonight !
we 'll be there :
author: Phil Daley
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: afternoon weather : cloudy with some rain
text: it will be staying cloudy with threatening skies through the rest of the day , giving outbreaks of rain at times .
while it will be relatively mild , it may not feel it in the strong southerly wind .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
for the full forecast where you are , visit bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: australian diy giant opens first uk store in herts
text: it 's a big name down under and it 's now arrived in the uk .
australian diy retailer bunnings has opened its first uk store in st albans , as part of a £ 500m investment plan by its owners .
it was opened by former england rugby star kyran bracken
the inaugural shop replaces one of st albans ' previous homebase stores in griffiths way , after the entire brand was acquired by bunnings ' parent company wesfarmers in a £ 340m deal last year .
wesfarmers has a market valuation of almost £ 27bn and is the largest private sector employer in australia , with about 220,000 staff .
the company plans to open at least four uk pilot locations by june , creating 120 jobs , and a total of 10 stores could be up and running by the end of the year .
managing director of bunnings uk and ireland , peter davis , confirmed a second bunnings warehouse store will also be based in st albans - on hatfield road - and is set to open in april .
looking forward to opening bunnings warehouse in st albans today !
@ twitterid @ twitterid
have fun x
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: standon calling : first headliner announced
text: orbital have been announced as the first headliner for the standon calling festival , being held in hertfordshire from 27 to 30 july .
more acts to be announced later on their website
we are very excited to announce the newly reformed @ twitterid as our first headliner for 2017 !
see you back here at 6pm for more
@ twitterid it 's been a while dust your dancing shoes off ?
ooooooh : )
@ twitterid new single out today too .
best you both add this one to your summer festie tour .
let me know when you get tickets
@ twitterid hire more staff .
take the night off .
go watch .
@ twitterid @ twitterid
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'ball-scratching ' jibe teacher banned
text: 'ball-scratching ' jibe teacher banned

documents.title: bedfordshire police seizes 56 vehicles in nuisance bikers crackdown
text: bedfordshire police has seized 56 bikes and arrested 12 people over the past year in an ongoing operation to tackle nuisance bikers .
the force says it 's keen to reassure the community the issue is being treated with the highest priority and officers are working on bringing those responsible to justice .
ch insp sean quinn is urging people to keep reporting incidents , with the operation also targeting teenagers with a reminder of the dangers involved .
speaking to andy collins on bbc three counties radio , he said : `` we had a 15-year-old boy in luton that was killed riding an off-road motorcycle .
we emphasise the danger element .
`` people are excited by doing this kind of thing but there are consequences . ''
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: hold on to your hats , it 's going to be windy tomorrow
text: a yellow warning of wind has been issued from 11:00 on friday , to 03:00 on saturday .

the met office says the likely scenario is for inland locations to see a relatively short period of 40-50mph ( 64-80km/h ) gusts , and coastal areas to see longer periods of 50-60mph ( 80-97km/h ) gusts .
yellow warning of wind for east of england

documents.title: girl 'may have been saved ' from sepsis
text: girl 'may have been saved ' from sepsis

documents.title: converted caravan to feed homeless in bedford
text: a local designer has teamed up with a homeless charity to convert a caravan into a mobile soup kitchen , which will feed homeless people in bedford .
max mcmurdo transformed his family caravan after volunteering for the charity emmaus last year .
the so-called 'soupervan ' will hit the road for the first time this evening , so i went to meet designer max and ian o'hara from the charity this morning .
love this .
this is the @ twitterid designed by @ twitterid and it will be feeding homeless people in bedford from tonight via @ twitterid
@ twitterid @ twitterid i 'm so proud of you guys , you said you 'd help and you did !
hope it goes well @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
author: Justin Dealey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: olympic sailing partnership to end
text: after finishing ninth in the sailing nacra 17 class at the rio olym ashwell 's ben saxton has ended his partnership with team-mate nicola groves .
the pair have competed together since 2015 , but groves is set to take a break from the sport .
the hertfordshire olympian says he 's keen to compete at the tokyo games in 2020 .
author: Geoff Doyle
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: police officer admits child porn charges
text: police officer admits child porn charges

documents.title: tunisia inquest : chris dyer 's death to be examined
text: the inquest into the shooting of 30 british holidaymakers in tunisia will today examine the death of chris dyer , from watford .
the 32-year-old was killed in june 2015 when a gunman opened fire at a beach resort hotel .
chris was on holiday with his wife gina van dort , who survived the attack despite being shot in the face .
today at london 's high court we are likely to hear more about who chris dyer was and what he was doing on the morning of 26 june before the gunman arrived .
author: Emily Unia
BBC reporter

documents.title: cowan-hall joins wycombe for fourth time
text: cowan-hall joins wycombe for fourth time

documents.title: weather : further rain and strong winds expected at times
text: there are more details on the bbc weather website .
weather : mild and damp with stronger winds .
top temp 11c , @ twitterid has thursday 's forecast :
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: brexit vote : gavin shuker abstains
text: last night mps backed the european union bill - allowing the pm to begin the brexit process - by 498 votes to 114 , with 47 labour rebels voting against .
all the mps in beds , herts and bucks voted for the bill except for gavin shuker , the labour mp for luton south , who abstained .
before the referendum , gavin shuker wanted the uk to remain in the eu .
we are trying to contact mr shuker for comment and will let you know what he says .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man 'critical ' after welwyn garden city hit-and-run
text: a man is in a critical condition in hospital after a hit-and-run in welwyn garden city last night .
hertfordshire police said the pedestrian was found with serious head injuries on tewin road , at the junction of mundells , at about 19:50 .
it 's believed he was hit by a vehicle that failed to stop .
the man , in his 40s , has been taken to addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge .
officers have called for witnesses to come forward .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sepsis girl , 6 , 'could have been saved '
text: a six-year-old girl who died from sepsis at the luton and dunstable hospital could have been saved if her condition was diagnosed when she first went there , a report has found .

a serious incident report into the death of goda janulevicuite in april last year found she was diagnosed with chickenpox and sent home , but the hospital had failed to detect the complications leading to sepsis .
by the following day when she was brought in as an emergency , she could n't be saved .
the review recommends using her case to highlight awareness of sepsis .
the luton and dunstable hospital called it a `` desperately sad case '' and said it had shared the review with goda 's parents and the coroner , who is due to hold an inquest .
`` because of this inquest , we are unable to comment further at this stage , '' the hospital said .
goda 's family have since returned to their native lithuania .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: helen bailey murder trial : cleaner noticed 'unusual ' things
text: a cleaner employed by children 's author helen bailey has told a murder trial she noticed `` unusual '' things in the writer 's home after she disappeared .
the 51-year-old 's body was found last july at the house she shared with ian stewart in royston , hertfordshire , three months after she went missing .
mr stewart , 56 , denies murder .
vania pedrosa told st albans crown court yesterday she went to their house on 13 april , two days before ms bailey was reported missing , and was told by mr stewart that she 'd gone away .
she said she saw clothes on top of a basket , which was out of character for `` very organised '' ms bailey .

ms pedrosa said there was also bedding drying in the dining room , which she described as `` unusual '' , and noticed a light green eiderdown that was normally on the couple 's bed but was not there any more .
the trial resumes this morning .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: welcome back to live updates from beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome to thursday 's live page for the three counties where we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather until 18:00 .
it 's another cloudy and wet morning but a full regional weather forecast is coming up soon so you can see what the day is set to bring .
but no matter what it looks like outside , you can always rely on a bbc weather watcher to find a lovely scene somewhere as this morning 's from haywayne in milton keynes shows .
meanwhile , you can contact us at any time via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's it for our live coverage
text: thanks for joining us on a poignant day where we said goodbye to football royalty , in the name of graham taylor .
here are the key points of the day :
scroll down to see more from the day .
we 'll be back with all the latest live updates for beds , herts and bucks tomorrow from 08:00 .
see you then .

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : how fans have reacted
text: here 's how some fans have been reacting on social media today :

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : tribute from sir elton john
text: `` to love somebody you must be prepared to be honest and open .
and graham was the most honest and open man i 've ever met .
he is a legend in this community , in football and in life .
i love you my friend .
thank you for everything . ''

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : how other media reported it
text: the watford observer today pays tribute to the `` football rebel who stood up for what he believed was right '' .
the newspaper also reveals that watford manager walter mazzarri dedicated the team 's remarkable 2-1 win at arsenal last night to the club legend .
the evening standard carries a gallery of images from today 's funeral and talks of how managers past and present came together to remember the man .
the wolverhampton express and star also remembered graham taylor for his contribution to the midlands club .

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : watford pays their respects
text: famous faces from the football world were joined by up to 1,000 fans in the centre of watford today to say their final goodbye to the legend that was graham taylor .
the service was relayed through big screens set up in the centre of watford and several roads were closed so the funeral cortège could travel through the town .

it was an emotional day for all and although it was a quiet and respectful scene , there were plenty of moments of light during the service , highlighting the love for graham taylor both inside and outside the church .
author: Douglas Marshall
BBC Journalist

documents.title: fans and legends at taylor farewell
text: fans and legends at taylor farewell

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : 'honoured to be here ' , says watford captain
text: troy deeney , the current watford captain , said it was an `` honour '' to attend the funeral of graham taylor .
he told me the `` work that he started , we are trying to continue and enhance '' at watford .
when i asked him about last night 's 2-1 win against arsenal , he thought the `` gaffer was there with us '' and it was `` a massive game and a massive win '' .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : 'fantastic turnout for the boss '
text: nigel gibbs , a former watford player , said today 's funeral service for graham taylor was a `` fantastic turnout for the boss '' .
he said it was a wonderful way to `` celebrate his life '' and remember the man who gave him his debut in football .
he added he was a `` wonderful man '' and a `` great influence '' .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : crowd cheers taylor
text: the hearse carrying graham taylor 's coffin has now left st mary 's church in the centre of watford and was applauded by mourners and the large crowds who 'd gathered to listen to the former manager 's funeral .
author: Douglas Marshall
BBC Journalist

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : watford says goodbye
text: mourners applaud graham taylor 's coffin as it leaves the church following his funeral # thankyougt
author: Douglas Marshall
BBC Journalist

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : live outside the church
text: we 're live once more following the funeral of graham taylor , as hundreds of well-wishers turned out to pay their respects to a footballing hero
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : coffin leaves church to warm applause
text: as the service ended it was time for the people of watford to say goodbye to graham taylor .
there was warm , generous applause as the coffin was lowered into the hearse outside st mary 's church .
crowds gathered all around and watched from the top of nearby car parks , flats and surrounding streets .
then after an afternoon of rain , the sun came out once again .
author: Nick Coffer
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : service ends
text: the coffin of graham taylor has left the church to amazing grace and applause from the crowd outside .
taylor 's family and invited friends will now go to the crematorium for a private committal before returning to watford football club for the wake .

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : prayers for taylor
text: everyone inside and outside the church has been asked to bow their heads for prayers .
they are being led by rev john boyers , the former chaplain at watford fc , and clive ross , the current watford fc chaplain .
mr ross said taylor had a `` passion for life '' and thanked god for his `` long career in football '' and for being an `` inspirational manager '' .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : service broadcast live on radio
text: we 're currently on air broadcasting live from the funeral service of graham taylor in watford .
you can listen to it here .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : 13-year-old graham 'knew he would marry rita '
text: rev john samways said graham taylor was a `` devoted '' family man and recounted that at the age of 13 graham met rita ( below ) , his wife , while he was playing lord grizzle in school play tom thumb the great .
rev samways said she was the make-up artist , and graham turned to his friend and said `` i 'm gon na marry that girl '' .
six years later , when he was still a teenager , he did just that and asked rita 's father for her hand in marriage .
they remained married until his death on 12 january .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : an 'utterly kind ' man
text: the rev john samways , a family friend and watford supporter of 64 years , has addressed the congregation .
he said graham taylor was `` a man , a friend who was utterly faithful and utterly kind '' and that whenever you met him you met the same man , because he `` never changed his values '' .

rev samways read out an email he had been sent from a fan , who said they remembered at the age of 10 how taylor had openly criticised fans for not being loud enough , then at the next game walked out on the pitch ahead of everyone else and held a placard above his head , which said `` i 'm sorry '' .
he said the move was `` met with a standing ovation '' .
it was a `` lesson for me in life '' , the emailer said .
rev samways went on to say taylor lived with `` humour and humility '' , and `` passion and purpose '' .
`` he was open and honest with everyone , and most importantly he was open and honest with himself , '' he said .
`` he was consistently kind , consistently faithful and consistently bad at diy . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor funeralfootball
text: the funeral of graham taylor is taking place this lunchtime .
watch the clip to see how bbc midlands today are reporting on the funeral .
during his career , taylor managed england , watford , aston villa , wolves and lincoln .
app users may need to click on the below link to watch the video .
the funeral is taking place this lunchtime in watford of former @ twitterid and @ twitterid boss graham taylor .
@ twitterid is there
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid thank you graham rip

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : applause for watford legend
text: applause for a watford fc legend as graham taylor arrives at st mary 's for a final farewell .

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : silence falls over watford
text: it 's raining here in watford , but the crowds are quiet outside as they raptly listen to graham taylor 's life being played out at his funeral service .
author: Douglas Marshall
BBC Journalist

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : crowds sing hymns
text: members of the public are joining in the singing of hymns outside graham taylor 's funeral .
there are hundreds of people lining the streets .
author: Douglas Marshall
BBC Journalist

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : sir elton - 'we were batman and robin '
text: john motson read out a tribute from former watford chairman sir elton john , who described graham taylor as being `` like a brother '' and a man he `` befriended and loved from the moment i first met him '' .

sir elton said as chairman and manager they were an `` unlikely twosome '' from the outside , but were very similar - `` fiercely ambitious '' , `` passionate '' , `` committed '' to the football club and an `` unstoppable force of nature '' .
`` as chairman and manager we were batman and robin , '' he said .
sir elton said he floundered when taylor went to aston villa as `` he 'd done the work of a thousand men at watford '' , but their friendship was `` cast in stone '' .
`` he was a legend in this community , in football and in life , '' he said .
john motson added words of his own at the end and got a cheer from the crowd outside after mentioning watford 's win at arsenal last night .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : 'thank you for the giggles '
text: it 's now the turn of graham taylor 's grandchildren to pay their respects .
rhianna described her grandfather as being `` quite a wind-up '' and they were `` always happy , smiling and that we can keep with us forever '' .
elsie said `` thank you for the giggles '' , while jake said he was a `` major influence in all of our lives , and you will never know how much we will miss you '' .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor 's hearse passes vicarage road stadium
text: as the funeral service continues , this was the scene earlier as graham taylor 's hearse passed his beloved vicarage road before heading to st mary 's church in watford .

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : daughter joanne talks of 'comfort ' from tributes
text: graham taylor 's daughter joanne spoke next and revealed the `` outpouring of tributes from people from all walks of life '' after his death were `` not only richly deserved but truly humbling and comforting for us as a family '' .
she said for him it was `` family first , except on match days '' , but `` for us it was dad first , graham taylor second '' .
she then brought laughs from the guests as she recounted how she once gave away one of his best coats to a charity shop .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : flowers in watford colours
text: crowds outside st mary 's church are listening quietly to graham taylor 's service .
his coffin was brought in by six pallbearers , with flowers reflecting the colours of watford football club .

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : reverend welcomes mourners to the service
text: at the start of the service , rev tony rindl has welcomed mourners to st mary 's and said how good it was to see a church full of graham taylor 's friends , family and former colleagues .
he said it was fitting that the service was in watford , a town `` so grateful for all he achieved '' .
he also thanked god for all graham gave us and how our `` lives are richer for having known him '' .
rev rindl also recognised the `` profound sense of loss '' and hoped everyone would `` find comfort in the words of the service '' .
the congregation then stood to sing lead us heavenly father lead us - a hymn sung at graham 's wedding to wife , rita .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : hundreds of people pay their respects
text: hundreds of people are watching the service live from big screens set up in watford town centre .
author: Douglas Marshall
BBC Journalist

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : service under way
text: graham taylor 's funeral service is under way at st mary 's church in watford .
there are 400 mourners inside .
taylor 's coffin was carried into the church to elgar 's nimrod from enigma variations , and guests will be welcomed by the rev tony rindl .
during the service tributes will come from graham 's daughter joanne and grandchildren rhianna , elsie and jake , while a tribute from sir elton john will be read by bbc commentator john motson .
the main address will be from the rev john samways - a watford supporter of 64 years and friend of the taylor family .
hymns will include lead us heavenly father lead us , abide with me and guide me o thou great redeemer , while readings will include ecclesiastes 3:1-13 read by john ward .
prayers will be led by rev john boyers and clive ross , the current chaplain of watford fc .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : and the rain stops
text: it may seem like a cliche , but after a morning of rain in watford , the sun has come out as graham taylor 's coffin arrives at st mary 's church .

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : more mourners arrive
text: former watford striker tommy mooney , chris kamara and tony coton have arrived at st mary 's church for graham taylor 's funeral , along with former watford player and manager sean dyche and current hornets coach walter mazzarri .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : hearse arrives at church
text: crowds in the centre of watford fell silent as the hearse arrived at st mary 's church .
hundreds are here and just as it pulled up , people spontaneously applauded the cortège .
graham taylor 's coffin is draped with the union jack .
author: Douglas Marshall
BBC Journalist

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : live outside the church
text: we 're on facebook broadcasting live from graham taylor 's funeral .
watch the coverage here
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : captain of watford arrives
text: watford 's current captain troy deeney has just arrived at graham taylor 's funeral
he joins former manager howard wilkinson ( right )
and martin keown

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : mourners arrive
text: most mourners have now arrived at st mary 's church in watford for graham taylor 's funeral .
watford heroes luther blissett and john barnes arrived together .
sir trevor brooking , former watford managers malky mackay and aidy boothroyd , david platt and former luton manager david pleat are also at the church .
meanwhile , the crowd is being treated to the vera lynn song we 'll meet again being played out of the speakers .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : 'a man who feels like family '
text: graham taylor was a massive part of watford for many football fans , and emotions are running high in the town this lunchtime ahead of his funeral .
jenny scott on why she wants to remember graham taylor # thankyougt
author: Douglas Marshall
BBC Journalist

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : former watford players arrive
text: former watford players are also arriving for graham taylor 's funeral .
so far i 've seen kenny jackett , tommy smith , alec chamberlain , sean dyche , malky mackay , ross jenkins , steve terry and steve sherwood .
crowds of fans are also growing outside st mary 's church .
author: Douglas Marshall
BBC Journalist

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : mourners begin to arrive
text: mourners , including the great and the good of football , have begun to arrive at st mary 's church in watford for the funeral of graham taylor .
so far former peterborough and barnet manager barry fry , former manchester united boss sir alex ferguson and ex-england midfielder tim sherwood have arrived .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor : hundreds of people now in place
text: mourners are now arriving outside st mary 's church in the centre of watford and there are maybe a couple of hundred people so far .
at the moment buddy holly songs are being played to the crowd - he was graham taylor 's favourite singer .
author: Douglas Marshall
BBC Journalist

documents.title: graham taylor : my memories
text: the memories of graham taylor that stand out for me are the warmth of the welcomes he received at former clubs .
they include a standing ovation at aston villa when watford reached the premier league in 1999 .
again when taylor got the best crystal glass for a post-match drink with wolves owner sir jack hayward , when the then wolves manager colin lee was drinking tea out of a plastic cup .

combine that with tributes from the likes of tony adams , who devoted his captain 's programme notes when arsenal played watford in 1999/2000 to taylor visiting him in prison while england manager , to tell adams he wanted him to be his captain .

personally , i remember being ticked off for suggesting that his side had been `` lacklustre '' in defeat at tranmere , but praised for a question about john barnes when he had just lost his job at celtic .
and then there was his ability to take a joke when i asked if arsenal had left anyone behind when watford inherited their training ground .
arriving at england versus sweden at the japan world cup in 2002 , there was a familiar face with a warm handshake .
sitting with him to watch the game is an abiding memory .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: graham taylor : 'absolute legend '
text: today is the day watford fans are able to pay their final respects to their legend , graham taylor .
gary armstrong is just one of them .
watford fan gary armstrong on why he wanted to pay his respects to graham taylor # thankyougt
author: Douglas Marshall
BBC Journalist

documents.title: graham taylor : fans brave weather to say goodbye
text: a cold and wet day is not putting fans off from paying their respects to graham taylor .
there 's still just over an hour to go before his funeral in watford , but many supporters are already in place .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor obituary : ex-england boss a fount of knowledge and a true gentleman
text: graham taylor will be remembered by many for his unfulfilling spell in charge of england - but by plenty more as an outstanding club manager at watford and aston villa and one of the nicest , most genuine men in the game .
the reaction to taylor 's death at the age of 72 , and the affection expressed for him , was the true measure of his standing inside and outside football .
read the full obituary .

as a bbc sport colleague , taylor was unfailingly co-operative and the consummate professional , willing to take a call at any time , even when he was meant to be spending time with his beloved wife rita .
and as well as a fount of knowledge and a man with strong opinions , taylor was also an endless source of entertainment and stories , just as happy to poke fun at himself as everyone else .
graham taylor was a top-class manager at club level and a true gentleman inside and outside of football .
he will be greatly missed and perhaps now his work in management , viewed through the prism of this sad news , will finally get the credit it fully deserves .
author: Phil McNulty
BBC Sport chief football writer

documents.title: graham taylor : 'true football man ' , says malky mackay
text: malky mackay , the former watford manager and player , was given the gaffer 's job by graham taylor .
he said his offers of help were `` invaluable '' and after many years they still `` kept in touch '' .
he described him as a `` true football man '' who was `` someone who cared about watford and the community aspect and kept reinforcing that with me , that we should be close to our community '' .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor : order of service being handed out
text: the order of service for graham taylor 's funeral is being handed out to people who 've turned up to pay their respects to the former watford manager .
it says the service at st mary 's church will include readings from his family , john motson on behalf of elton john and the hymn abide with me .
author: Douglas Marshall
BBC Journalist

documents.title: graham taylor : crowds begin to arrive for funeral
text: there 's steady rain in watford at the moment , but a few dozen people have already arrived outside st mary 's church in the town centre , two hours ahead of graham taylor 's funeral .
author: Douglas Marshall
BBC Journalist

documents.title: graham taylor : pub transformed to remember football hero
text: the recently closed one bell pub in watford has been transformed into a tribute to graham taylor , ahead of his funeral at 13:00 .
it even includes quotes from the great man himself covering the boarded-up windows .
author: Douglas Marshall
BBC Journalist

documents.title: graham taylor : mayor of watford pays tribute
text: dorothy thornhill , the mayor of watford , said despite the sadness of his passing , the funeral of football legend graham taylor should be an `` uplifting '' day and an `` historic moment for our town '' .
she said she 's expecting thousands of people to line the streets to pay their respects later .
`` i hope that our town wraps that family up in love and they feel how much graham meant to us , '' she said .
meanwhile , big screens are up in the town centre ready to relay the funeral to the crowds outside st mary 's church .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor : 'he 'll never be forgotten '
text: the first graham taylor fan who turned up outside st mary 's church in watford , where his funeral will take place at 13:00 , was gina hall .
she was very emotional as she told me he was `` watford , and he 'll never be forgotten '' .

she explained he helped her family personally by sending a cheque to her daughter so she could train as a disabled athlete abroad , and even gave her husband a signed football shirt when he was diagnosed with cancer .
as she 's only 4ft 11in , she even brought a stepladder with her to make sure she 'll be able to see above the throng of supporters .
she told me , through tears , `` at night he 's the brightest star shining over watford '' .
author: Justin Dealey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: 'all good things come to an end'football
text: midfielder adlene guedioura has just posted this rather long message on twitter , after leaving watford last night to join middlesbrough .
guedioura , 31 , played for watford 54 times over the last three seasons , including two loan spells , and has signed a two-and-a-half-year deal with boro after moving for an undisclosed fee .

documents.title: 'there 's only one graham taylor '
text: `` on the eve of graham taylor 's funeral , watford produced a fitting performance , the sort taylor 's teams of the eighties used to churn out with regularity , to spectacularly and unexpectedly bloody the nose of one of the big boys .
what a night . ''
watford 's match report writer did n't mince their words on the club 's website last night , after the team 's surprise 2-1 away win at arsenal .
the crowd paid their own respects at the end of the game

author: Alex Pope

documents.title: graham taylor : 'a man of his word '
text: this morning i 've been speaking to rev john samways , who was a close friend of graham taylor and will be leading today 's funeral service .
he told me some of his abiding memories of the former watford manager .
`` graham above all was a man of his word , and if he promised he 'd do something he would deliver , '' he said .
rev samways recalled a time when taylor agreed to visit a local school and his `` diary was a bit conflicted '' .
he was in america the day before and flew back overnight .
`` he flew into the north of england somewhere and still turned up at the school on time , '' rev samways said .
`` he delivered as only graham can , without any reference to where he 'd come from , he was completely selfless - he gave his all and that was graham . ''
author: Justin Dealey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: remembering graham taylorfootball
text: football fans across the world have been remembering former watford and england manager graham taylor since the news of his death .
taylor died on 12 january at the age of 72 of a suspected heart attack .
watford saluted the club 's `` greatest manager of all time '' before their home premier league match against middlesbrough at vicarage road on 14 january .
his funeral will take place at 13:00 gmt at st mary 's church in watford , hertfordshire .

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : 'a day of celebration ' , reverend says
text: i 'm in watford this morning where i 've been talking to rev john samways , who will be leading graham taylor 's funeral service later today .
he told me it would be a day to celebrate taylor 's life .
`` what a life , '' he said .
`` a life that was poured out into the world of football , poured out into the community , poured out into every encounter he ever had with anybody - it truly will be a day of celebration . ''
reverend john samways is leading the service at graham taylor 's funeral today .
he and graham have been friends for years x
author: Justin Dealey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: graham taylor : a life in football
text: born in worksop in nottinghamshire , graham taylor became a football manager after retiring as a player with lincoln city in 1972 .
author: Phil McNulty
BBC Sport chief football writer

documents.title: stevenage re-sign spurs ' ogilvie
text: stevenage re-sign spurs ' ogilvie

documents.title: deeney dedicates watford 's victory to taylor
text: meanwhile , watford captain troy deeney dedicated last night 's 2-1 win away at arsenal to graham taylor .
younes kaboul scored the opener within 10 minutes for watford .
however , just two minutes and 57 seconds later the visitors doubled their lead , as troy deeney tapped in the rebound after etienne capoue 's fine run ended with his shot being saved by petr cech .
in the second half alex iwobi pulled a goal back by steering alexis sanchez 's cross home .
deeney said : `` the first half performance would have been something him and his family would have been very proud of .
`` there 's not much i or the team can say , so obviously to give a performance like that and a result like that the day before his funeral is probably the best we can give .
`` obviously myself and a few club representatives will be [ at the funeral ] and we wish his family all the best moving forward . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graham taylor funeral : road closures in place
text: a large turnout is expected in watford town centre today as people pay their respects to graham taylor .
as a result , watford council arranged for a number of roads in the vicinity of st mary 's church to be closed temporarily , so the event can take place safely .
george street , church street and new street closed at about 07:00 and will remain shut until about 16:00 - depending how quickly the crowd disperses .
it will be implemented by a staffed barrier in george street close to the king street junction , and access to premises on these roads will be allowed until about 12:30 .
in addition , high street - from king street to market street - will be closed from 13:00 to 15:00 and buses will be diverted .
public footpaths crossing the churchyard will be closed , but the footpath link from the high street ( next to brighthouse ) to church street , opposite the alms houses , will remain open .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: funeral of graham taylor takes place today
text: the funeral takes place today of the former watford and england football manager graham taylor , who died on 12 january aged 72 .
the service will take place at st mary 's church in watford at 13:00 and will be relayed to the public outside on big screens .
taylor is a hornets legend after leading the club from the fourth division to the first in five years , from 1977 to 1982 .
he also got them into the premiership during his second spell at the club in the late 1990s .
in 2014 , watford renamed the rous stand the graham taylor stand to honour his achievements .
the local council said a significant number of people are expected to gather in the vicinity of the church to pay their respects and a number of roads will be closed temporarily .
full details coming up next .
by the way , if you ca n't make the service , stick with us for coverage here on local live .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nice weather for ducks
text: today it 'll be cloudy and misty with outbreaks of rain and drizzle through the morning .
gradually it 'll turn drier and brighter from the west during the afternoon , although rain may linger near the east coast .
author: BBC Weather
